Comments_List: I learned more about how to be a better storyteller through the visual media.

I learnt the proper formatting rules of screenwriting, as well as the different ways to capture an audience's attention in a script. I also learnt how to write script coverages and basic ground rules that a screenwriter follows.

I really enjoyed the workshop sessions and wish there could have been more of them. I was also exposed to a lot of fun screenplays and movies throughout the class. More time could have been spent delving into the intricacies of a screenplay and discussing the different things that make a screenplay enjoyable or surprising. However, a lot of time was spent on lectures instead.
Totally! Especially if you're trying to figure out if you might have a thing for screenwriting

Yes. It is a good introduction level crash course to screenwriting. It covered the fundamentals of writing a screenplay while forcing us to work out the kinks of our stories within a short amount of time, which is good writing practice for working with a tight deadline.
